eddy.lang

Class Rule.Modality

  • java.lang.Object
    • eddy.lang.Rule.Modality
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Rule.Modality>
    Enclosing class:
    Rule

    public static class Rule.Modality
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Rule.Modality>
    Describes the modality of a Rule. The modality may be expressed as one of: PERMISSION, if the action is permitted; OBLIGATION, if the action is required; REFRAINMENT, if the action is prohibited; and EXCLUSION, if the action is not covered by the policy. In addition, exclusions may be further restricted to one of: EXCLUSION_PERMISSION, if the policy excludes the permitted action; EXCLUSION_OBLIGATION, if the policy excludes the required action; EXCLUSION_REFRAINMENT, if the policy excludes the prohibited action. In the case of constrained exclusion, rules with a modality outside of the excluded modality may appear in the policy. For example, a policy may not contain permitted actions of the excluded type, but it may contain prohibitions over those same actions.
    Author:
    Travis Breaux
